summary: A letter from New York Daily News reporter Stephen Rex Brown to Judge Katherine Polk Failla requesting the unsealing of court transcripts and documents related to Efrain Reyes, who was the last person to share a cell with Jeffrey Epstein. The letter argues for public access under First Amendment principles and notes Reyes's death.

persons.name: Stephen Rex Brown
persons.role: Reporter for New York Daily News
persons.context: Author of the letter requesting unsealing of court documents related to Efrain Reyes, citing public interest and First Amendment rights.

persons.name: Katherine Polk Failla
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who is being asked to unseal court proceedings and documents related to Efrain Reyes.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: The subject of the sealed court proceedings; he was the last person to share a cell with Jeffrey Epstein and died recently.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the person with whom Efrain Reyes last shared a cell, providing context for public interest in Reyes's case.

connections.description: Reyes was the last person to share a cell with Jeffrey Epstein, as noted in the document.
Brown writes a formal letter to Judge Failla requesting the unsealing of court documents.

events.title: Reyes Change of Plea Hearing
events.description: Efrain Reyes's change of plea hearing, the transcript of which is under seal.

events.title: Reyes Sentencing
events.description: Sentencing proceeding for Efrain Reyes, transcript under seal.

events.title: Death of Efrain Reyes
events.description: Efrain Reyes died at his mother's apartment in the Bronx the month prior to the letter (December 2020).

locations: Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, NY, NY 10007
keyFacts: Efrain Reyes was the last person to share a cell with Jeffrey Epstein.
Reyes died in November 2020 at his mother's apartment in the Bronx.
Transcripts of Reyes's change of plea hearing (August 26, 2019) and sentencing (April 13, 2020) are under seal.
A reporter is formally requesting these documents be unsealed, citing public interest and First Amendment rights.
The court has ordered parties to respond to the unsealing request by January 22, 2021.
